Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2008 02:49PM lissa71 wrote: Hi!  Well I saw my dr. and she didn't have the results - it seems she offended the readiologist team by ordering the mri.  Preliminary results are that it is just post-surgical changes - but she was more concerned about the discharge.  She ran a test on it for blood and is trying to get me into my surgeon sooner.  I currently have an appt. for 12/30 and they just want to leave it for then.  I am thinking that is too long to wait.  Should I look for another doctor to see?  My first appt. took over 2 months.  I hate waiting.
Posts.Title: scared and worried lissa71 nixieschaos

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2008 05:02PM lissa71 wrote: HI!  I called to get my results today sent to me so I have them and was told by the hospital there is a per page charge of .89 for the first 25; then it is .79 up to 100, then .59 etc. and that I needed to disclose why I wanted the results.  I was shocked.  Has anyone else ever heard of being charged for thier test results?

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2008 05:08PM lissa71 wrote: Thanks for replying!  I feel like a whiner and worrier.  I did call both facilities for all my results.  I don't know where to turn for a second opinion.  How do you find another doctor?  I feel like such an idiot.

Posts.Content: lissa71 wrote: Hi! I have been reading the posts and a bunch of them apply to me.  I am going to start at the beginning. I am 37, had a complete Hyst. at 33 for endometriosis, have two sons - 17 & 14.  Family history - mom had a lumpectomy and is on some preventive medicine for the next five years - not tamox. something else.  She had two sisters die of BC - one at 40 & one in her mid-50's.  My maternal grandma, at least 2 of her sisters and several of mom's cousins all have BC too.  Now back to me - In February I started having discharge - seen my GYN - she ran bloodwork & sent me to a surgeon.  Had a glactogram and then in May a ductal excision where they removed 5 papillomas. In July - found a lump.  Had a mammo/US -saw nothing but post operative changes. Saw Breast surgeon in Aug.  told to only do breast exams laying down not in the shower (that way I won't feel it) and not worry and to come back in 4 months.  Left feeling like I was a huge hyprochondriac (sp). Oct 3rd-went for my yearly.  Told my gyn I was not comfortable and she ordered a MRI to pacify me.  She feels what I am feeling but I got the feeling that she thinks I am overly worried.  So in between my check up and yesterday - I noticed some discharge not alot.  At first - I thought it was just me having spilled or something.  So Sunday night it was there again.....Yesterday I went for my mri - I told the tech. She ran the tests and told me that they were ordering copies of all my previous mammos. They only had the ones from last year and this year and then asked me/told me I needed to make an appt. with my dr.  So I called my dr. today.  The nurse said they don't have any results - but they need to see me on Monday.  Is this normal - or is there something that they think is there?  I thought they would just call me back and tell me the results over the phone like the do for bloodwork etc.  Should I be in the panic I am?  Am I totally over-reacting and worrying for nothing???? I would really appreciate any feedback and advice you may have- because I am scared. Thanks- Melissa Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: scared and worried lissa71 nixieschaos

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2008 09:37PM lissa71 wrote: I live in North Central IL.  I sent you a private message with more details....
Posts.Title: scared and worried lissa71 nixieschaos

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 08:42PM lissa71 wrote: No mine was in IL.  I thought it was pretty common of a test.  They did it before my excisional biopsy too.  The confusion might be because of the different names - call back and refer to it as a glactogram or ductagram vice versa.  My surgeon referred to it as a ductogram - but the hospital and radiologist called it a glactogram either way I know one is in my future again - and I am not looking forward to having it.
Posts.Title: Massachusetts Ladies Help Please Hanaki Makratz

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 09:18PM lissa71 wrote: Well-it was not fun.  I told my gyn on my last visit if I need another I want something to relax me first.  They put a catheter into your nipple through the duct that is leaking - then they put contrast into the duct and do a mammo with the catheter in your nipple.  It allows them to see if there are any oddities in the duct.  The first one was not as bad as the one the day of the surgery.  The mammogram machine broke with me in it while they were trying to do the wire placement and I already had the dye/catheter in.  The room filled up quickly with people trying to fix the machine - I have no modesty left.  By time we were done I was in tears and my surgeon even said iwhat I had just done was worse than the surgery was going to be.  Seriously though it is more uncomfortable and buring than painful....But I will do it again to find out what the discharge is - I'm just scared...What color is your discharge?  the first time it was clear - this time it is clear or yellow....Good Luck.  Let me know what you find out - so far all my imagining has been negative for cancer - with lots of other stuff going - cysts, microcalcifications, pappillomas etc.
Posts.Title: Massachusetts Ladies Help Please Hanaki Makratz

Posts.Content: Nov 17, 2008 08:25PM lissa71 wrote: I am not sure about the test you are talking about - but the first time I had discharge they did a glactogram/ductogram and found multiple pappillomas.  I am once again having discharge and no one is overly concerned but me.  I just saw a new surgeon last month and have another diag. mammo & US  scheduled for 1/2/09.  If you haven't had a ductomgram/glactogram yet - see if they can order that - it might provide a few answers.
Posts.Title: Massachusetts Ladies Help Please Hanaki Makratz

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2008 08:44PM lissa71 wrote: It seemed like forever but probably about 1/2 hour or so.  My husband thought they took me straight to surgery becuase I was gone so long..... Good luck with the test!  Let me know how it goes.
